That's a fantastic idea! Having a live demo area with a large screen display behind the presenter and a smaller screen in front of them can be a highly effective way to showcase your software's capabilities. This setup can help attendees understand the software's interface, features, and backend workings in a clear and engaging way.

Here are some benefits of this setup:

**Large Screen Display (Behind the Presenter):**

* Allows attendees to see the software's interface and features in a large, clear format
* Can display demo scenarios, tutorials, or real-world examples to illustrate the software's capabilities
* Can be used to show dashboards, reports, or visualizations that demonstrate the software's value proposition
* Can be easily seen by a large group of attendees, making it an effective way to draw in a crowd

**Smaller Screen (In Front of the Presenter):**

* Enables the presenter to show the software's backend, such as code, architecture, or data flows
* Allows attendees to see the "under the hood" workings of the software, which can be particularly interesting for technical attendees
* Can be used to highlight specific features, such as AI-powered algorithms or machine learning models
* Provides a more intimate, detailed view of the software's inner workings, which can be useful for attendees who want to dive deeper

This setup also creates a nice balance between showing the software's user-facing interface and its technical capabilities. By having both screens, you can cater to different learning styles and interests, ensuring that attendees get a comprehensive understanding of your software.

To make the most of this setup, consider the following:

* Ensure the screens are large enough to be easily seen by attendees, but not so large that they overwhelm the demo area.
* Use high-quality displays with good brightness and resolution to ensure the software is displayed clearly.
* Consider using a wireless presentation system to allow the presenter to move freely around the demo area while presenting.
* Make sure the presenter is comfortable with the demo script and can easily switch between the two screens to show different aspects of the software.
* Have a clear and concise presentation that highlights the software's key features, benefits, and value proposition.

By incorporating this demo area setup into your booth design, you'll be able to effectively showcase your AI-powered software and provide attendees with a engaging, informative, and memorable experience. Good luck with your demo!
